bibl.title: Letter from George L. Goodale to the Adjutant General, October 18, 1900

div1.p: Goodale describes Peterson's burial at Grave 146, Post Cemetery, Columbia Barracks, Cuba. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from George L. Goodale to the Adjutant General, October 18, 1900
div1.opener:
FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Peterson
mes letters received
Dept of Cuba 1900-1901
Office of the Post Quartermaster,
Columbia Barracks,
Quemados, Cuba, October 18, 1900.
The Adjutant,
Columbia Barracks, Cuba.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to inform you that the remains of the late
Major Matt R. Peterson, Commissary of Subsistence, U.S.V., who
died at Las Animas Hospital, Havana, Cuba, October 17th, 1900,
at 9 o'clock P. M., were this day interred in Grave No. 146,
Post Cemetery, Columbia Barracks, Cuba.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Geo. L. Goodale Captain & A.Q.M., U.S.V.,
Quartermaster.
383/ E-1900.
O.C. to A.G. Div of Cuba. for his inf se;
